Susan Powell was just 28 years-old when she vanished from her suburban home in West Valley City, Utah in 2009." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10108664/","name":"The Disappearance of Susan Cox Powell","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWJjNWE4MTQtOWE2NS00ZWJiLWJjNDUtNjI5Y2NmMDI2MDdhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzk1MzU0MzQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Susan Powell was just 28 years-old when she vanished from her suburban home in West Valley City, Utah in 2009.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10108664/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"rdoubleoc","dateCreated":"2019-05-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Oxygen at it's finest.","reviewBody":"I had never heard of this case before now, but have watched a lot of Oxygen's real-life crime shows, and this one was just as good.\n\nThey do a really good job of showing the whole picture (the thing news articles don't really do a good job of). programme.desc: Proste rzeczy: Directed by Grzegorz Zariczny. With Blazej Kitowski, Magdalena Sztorc, Tomasz Schimscheiner, Alicja Kitowska. programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

credits.actor: Marta Ścisłowicz
Piotr Czarniecki
Michał Jaros
Elżbieta Studniarek
Natan Kryczyński

programme.title: Wolyn
Wołyń
programme.desc: Wolyn: Directed by Wojciech Smarzowski. With Michalina Labacz, Arkadiusz Jakubik, Wasyl Wasylik, Adrian Zaremba. Despite being in love with a Ukrainian boy from the same village, Polish girl named Zosia is forced into marrying a wealthy widower. Soon World War II begins and ethnic tensions arise. programme.title: Transfer kosmicznej energii
programme.desc: Radek jest ambitnym coachem motywacyjnym. Robi karierę w korporacji. Mężczyzna traci pewność siebie w momencie, gdy uczestniczy w bójce w knajpie. Decyduje się na nielegalne techniki hakowania mózgu. Niestety rezultaty są inne, niż się spodziewał.

On Chesil Beach
programme.desc: On Chesil Beach: Directed by Dominic Cooke. With Billy Howle, Saoirse Ronan, Andy Burse, Rasmus Hardiker. programme.title: Jestem tutaj
programme.desc: Niespodziewany przyjazd młodszego brata Stefana (Miłosz Frydrychowicz) zmusza dwudziestoletnią Hanię (Marianna Kowalewska) do zmierzenia się z trudną przeszłością i do odnowy kontaktu z dawno niewidzianą matką. Przez wzgląd na chłopaka dziewczyna musi dać szansę tej skomplikowanej relacji.

credits.actor: Marianna Kowalewska

programme.title: Ewolucja Jackiego Chana
programme.desc: Kulisy spektakularnej kariery Jackiego Chana. Tego znanego artystę można nazwać człowiekiem instytucją. Oprócz tego że jest cenionym aktorem, pracuje także jako kaskader, scenarzysta i reżyser, a także biznesmen. Jak nikt inny w branży filmowej potrafi widowiskowo łączyć azjatyckie kino sztuk walki z chaplinowskim humorem oraz hollywoodzkim rozmachem.

programme.title: Nimic
programme.desc: Mężczyzna w średnim wieku (Matt Dillon), który jest głową rodziny i zarabia na życie, grając na wiolonczeli, spotyka w metrze pewną kobietę. To z pozoru typowe wydarzenie odciska piętno na jego dalszym życiu.

After years abroad in Paris, Selma returns to Tunis with the dream of opening up her own psychotherapy practice." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9648886/","name":"Un divan à Tunis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3MjRhNzctYWQ4OC00Nzg0LWIwMzYtYWVjN2ZmMjUyNTExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjgzMjQ0MTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"After years abroad in Paris, Selma returns to Tunis with the dream of opening up her own psychotherapy practice.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9648886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"On the Couch","reviewBody":"The struggle to become something or someone .. to succeed in ones profession or dream/pursuit. Psychologically speaking there is more to it. Great central performance, great persistence, great fight for what she believes in. And really fun and interesting side stories of the ... side characters overall. programme.title: Once
Once
programme.desc:
Once: Directed by John Carney. With Glen Hansard, Markéta Irglová, Hugh Walsh, Gerard Hendrick. A modern-day musical about a busker and an immigrant and their eventful week in Dublin, as they write, rehearse and record songs that tell their love story." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0907657/","name":"Once","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWUxZjJkMDktZmMxMS00Mzg3LTk4MDItN2IwODlmN2E0MTM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern-day musical about a busker and an immigrant and their eventful week in Dublin, as they write, rehearse and record songs that tell their love story.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0907657/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"papaska"},"dateCreated":"2007-01-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Music Music Music Music","reviewBody":"This is a wonderful, fun and touching movie. At a screening at Sundance 2007 the director described it as a musical, and it really is. The primary actors are musicians and their songs tie the movie together and tie you to them. Although the primary cast aren't actors as a first profession, they are very natural together and the film flows very well because of it. Everyone involved in this film has a great passion for music, and it is very infectious. It is one of the few films I have seen in 7 years at Sundance that received a standing ovation. 

From the Sundance film guide: "A Dublin busker, who ekes out a living playing guitar and repairing vacuum cleaners for his dad's shop, meets a young Czech immigrant who sells roses on the same street. She likes his song, and what's more she has a broken vacuum cleaner! They soon find themselves playing music together in a nearby music store (since she can't afford a piano, the owner lets her play his floor models). Over the course of a week, they form a musical rapport and, newly inspired, decide to record an album. 

Once may loosely be classified as a musical, but it has a refreshing vérité inflection. Conceived by director John Carney as a "video album," it sports a scrappy, unembellished naturalism. Carney took a risk in choosing professional musicians over professional actors, but Glen Hansard (of the well-known Irish band the Frames) and Marketa Irglova (a Czech singer/songwriter) are not only remarkably charming together but they're equally adept with the more melancholy shades (Hansard's lonely soul, stuck on an old flame; Irglova struggling to support a mother and daughter). Burdened and brokenhearted, their musical bond is the heart of the film and of their love. 

Great music aside, what makes this film special is how little effort it seems to exert. If it's possible to be blindsided by simplicity--a light touch, Once does it."  John Nein","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":114119,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Music","Romance"],"datePublished":"2007-03-23","keywords":"independent film,ireland,payphone,watching tv,scene during opening credits","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Once","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2275016985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWQ0YmZmY2ItNTA2NC00NzYyLTlkOTUtNjI0MmU5MTBjMDg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWQ0YmZmY2ItNTA2NC00NzYyLTlkOTUtNjI0MmU5MTBjMDg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Fox Searchlight Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0360598/","name":"Glen Hansard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2461627/","name":"Markéta Irglová"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2008013/","name":"Hugh Walsh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0138809/","name":"John Carney"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0018776/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065724/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012116/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0138809/","name":"John Carney"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Eye
Niebo nad Paryżem
Paris
programme.desc:
The Eye: Directed by David Moreau, Xavier Palud. With Jessica Alba, Alessandro Nivola, Parker Posey, Rade Serbedzija. Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0406759/","name":"The Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjczYmJhNjUtOTdmYi00MzZlLWEzOWYtNzA1ZGZjMjkwY2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406759/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"grangers-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-03-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Alba reminds us that you may want to check where that donated organ came from.","reviewBody":"Jessica Alba plays a woman who undergoes cornea transplants in a remake of a Chinese film of the same name.

The moment she opens her eyes she starts to see things that aren't there. These include (a) a number of grim reapers, (b) recently dead people, (c) vivid images of someone else's past premonitions, and (d) a director and editor who aren't sure whether their making a horror film, thriller or a 'who dunnit?'.

There is a faint oriental air to the film with does add a bit of mystery. This is essentially a relatively cheaply made Alba-vehicle. There is no-one else in it other than a periodically appearing sister and a doctor who you never quite get interested in as he has nothing of worth to say.

You do jump from minor shock every now and then (but then an unexpected rapid orchestral crescendo does that to most people).

The film is similar in feel to Sarah Michelle-Gellar's The Grudge. IMDb data; ttnr: 0406759, Title: The Eye, --- Description: The Eye: Directed by David Moreau, Xavier Palud. With Jessica Alba, Alessandro Nivola, Parker Posey, Rade Serbedzija. Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0406759/","name":"The Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjczYmJhNjUtOTdmYi00MzZlLWEzOWYtNzA1ZGZjMjkwY2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406759/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"grangers-1","dateCreated":"2008-03-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Alba reminds us that you may want to check where that donated organ came from.","reviewBody":"Jessica Alba plays a woman who undergoes cornea transplants in a remake of a Chinese film of the same name.

The moment she opens her eyes she starts to see things that aren't there. These include (a) a number of grim reapers, (b) recently dead people, (c) vivid images of someone else's past premonitions, and (d) a director and editor who aren't sure whether their making a horror film, thriller or a 'who dunnit?'.

There is a faint oriental air to the film with does add a bit of mystery. This is essentially a relatively cheaply made Alba-vehicle. There is no-one else in it other than a periodically appearing sister and a doctor who you never quite get interested in as he has nothing of worth to say.

You do jump from minor shock every now and then (but then an unexpected rapid orchestral crescendo does that to most people).

The film is similar in feel to Sarah Michelle-Gellar's The Grudge. You are left with a similar feeling when you leave the cinema; a resigned "it was okay".","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52917,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-10-29","keywords":"corneal transplant,eye,violinist,eye transplant,seeing dead people","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi263323929","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Eye Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004695/","name":"Jessica Alba","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219963/","name":"David Moreau","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0658837/","name":"Xavier Palud"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179341/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0349406/","name":"Sebastian Gutierrez","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1040327/","name":"Yuet-Jan Hui","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sous le sable
Pod piaskiem
Sous le sable
programme.desc:
Sous le sable: Directed by François Ozon. With Charlotte Rampling, Bruno Cremer, Jacques Nolot, Alexandra Stewart. When her husband goes missing at the beach, a female professor begins to mentally disintegrate as her denial of his disappearance becomes delusional." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0240913/","name":"Sous le sable","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM0ZDJhMjAtMWQ0MS00NTQwLWIyZjctYWZiYzRlODM4YTNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODU4MzMxNDg@._V1_.jpg","description":"When her husband goes missing at the beach, a female professor begins to mentally disintegrate as her denial of his disappearance becomes delusional.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0240913/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ThreeSadTigers"},"dateCreated":"2008-03-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Three Colours Beige","reviewBody":"François Ozon's Under the Sand is a great departure from his previous films, trading the bold and over the top farce of Sitcom and the brash melodrama of Criminal Lovers for something much more restrained. As a result, this is a mature film about mature characters, shot in a low-key style that is beautiful, though unobtrusive; with Ozon's camera finding a sense of poetry and evocation in even the most mundane of objects to help further express the sense of grief and remembrance so central to the spirit of our main protagonist. To help convey this, the filmmaker instills his work with a lethargic mood, drawing on the silences of scenes and the physical and emotional distances between his characters to create something that is much more internal and subjective than the ensemble films that he is best known for (Sitcom, Water Drops On Burning Rocks, 8 Women, etc).

It's almost a cliché to reference Bergman when talking of films that focus almost solely on the existential matters at the heart of their characters, but I suppose it could be relevant here; the film also reminded me, in tone, of Woody Allen's Bergman-esquire drama Interiors, or perhaps even Another Woman, with the film often confining itself to cramped and quiet locations in which characters meet for sex and lengthy semi-philosophical discussion. It's certainly not a film for the Friday night matinée crowd, but I'd imagine that goes without saying; with the story focusing on middle-aged characters and themes like grief, regret, loss and mental illness. However, the film manages to transcend the chamber-piece trappings of the Bergman style of drama by also giving us an element of mystery. It would be wrong to reveal too much about this central concept in something as ultimately superficial as a product review, although it's safe to say that the film hinges around a question of bereavement and the way in which this bereavement, or loss, is viewed by our central character in relation to those around her.

In this respect the film is similar to George Sluizer's original version of The Vanishing, in the respect that both of these films pivot around a mysterious disappearance, which leaves the absentee's lover desperately searching for some kind of closure. Unlike The Vanishing however, Under the Sand relegates the more obvious thriller elements to the background in order to more closely analyse the effect of the disappearance and possible death on his lover and her different methods of coming to terms with it. Ozon, as evident from films like Water Drops On Burning Rocks and Swimming Pool, has a strong grasp on his actors, and here draws some beautifully rendered performances from his highly esteemed cast. As some of the other comments have already noted, the central performance from Charlotte Rampling is an absolute revelation, as she creates a character that remains elusive throughout, but at the same time, is completely sympathetic. A much understated drama."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10049,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2001-02-07","keywords":"female frontal nudity,sex,male frontal nudity,female nudity,female masturbation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001648/","name":"Charlotte Rampling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0187337/","name":"Bruno Cremer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0634500/","name":"Jacques Nolot"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654830/","name":"François Ozon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070053/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030799/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654830/","name":"François Ozon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0076814/","name":"Emmanuèle Bernheim"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0888418/","name":"Marina de Van"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mój kraj taki piękny
programme.desc: W Polsce trwa spór pomiędzy dwoma ugrupowaniami - narodowcami i ich przeciwnikami. Grzegorz Paprzycki dokumentuje przebieg tych potyczek. Pojawia się w samym środku wydarzeń, podczas których niejednokrotnie dochodzi do aktów przemocy. Film stanowi subiektywne spojrzenie na konflikt, który toczy się na polskich ulicach. Za swój obraz reżyser otrzymał Złotego Lajkonika na Krakowskim Festiwalu Filmowym.

credits.actor: Jakub Kopeć

programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

programme.title: We mnie
programme.desc: Sandra (Małgorzata Gorol) świętuje swój wieczór panieński. Zbliża się dzień ślubu, ale przedtem musi poddać się aborcji - płód ma wady genetyczne. Do szpitala jedzie z nią narzeczony. Z każdą kolejną minutą mężczyzna wydaje się Sandrze coraz bardziej obcy. Po zabiegu kobieta postanawia szczerze z nim porozmawiać.

Spotkanie nie przebiega jednak zgodnie z planem. Im bardziej samotna kobieta próbuje rozbawić bliskich, tym mniej komfortowo się oni czują.

programme.title: London Town
London Town
programme.desc:
London Town: Directed by Derrick Borte. With Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Daniel Huttlestone, Dougray Scott, Natascha McElhone. In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1724597/","name":"London Town","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3NjU2MjYzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTk4NzgwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1724597/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"katzco-545-81470"},"dateCreated":"2016-10-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"A film that is music for the eyes, the ears and the heart!","reviewBody":"Every once in a while a little film, with a tiny budget and a whole lot of heart, comes along and knocks you off your feet. London Town fulfills all the aspects of that category. 

I won't bother to give you a blow by blow description of the story, that's easily found elsewhere. I will tell you I was more than thoroughly entertained and, since it was a 48 hour rental via my VOD system, I took the opportunity to watch it three times because it was just that good! The film is endearing, funny and the performances are stellar, especially the youngsters. Huttlestone is already on his way as a multi-talent, but Nell Williams was a new revelation for me and she shines here. 

If for no other reason, you need to see this film for the incredibly brilliant work of Jonathan Rhys Meyers as Joe Strummer. He is simply mesmerizing and delivers a musical performance equal to that of any contemporary or historical rock star. (As a veteran of 7 Stones and 14 WHO concerts, I feel justified in that statement.) Derrick Borte managed to assemble a superb group of musicians to portray the rest of the band and the results are magical. 

London Town is a special film, with something for everyone to love. Don't miss it!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2297,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2016-10-07","keywords":"the clash,pantyhose,miniskirt,fishnet pantyhose,losing virginity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3651909145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 70's London, a teenager is introduced to The Clash by his estranged mother and it changes his life forever."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001667/","name":"Jonathan Rhys Meyers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4948519/","name":"Daniel Huttlestone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779084/","name":"Dougray Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0097517/","name":"Derrick Borte"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296298/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030755/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0375102/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0114226/","name":"Matt Brown"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0839503/","name":"Sonya Gildea"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792202/","name":"Kirsten Sheridan"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1724597, Title: London Town, --- Description: London Town: Directed by Derrick Borte. With Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Daniel Huttlestone, Dougray Scott, Natascha McElhone. In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1724597/","name":"London Town","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3NjU2MjYzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTk4NzgwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1724597/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"katzco-545-81470","dateCreated":"2016-10-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"A film that is music for the eyes, the ears and the heart!","reviewBody":"Every once in a while a little film, with a tiny budget and a whole lot of heart, comes along and knocks you off your feet. London Town fulfills all the aspects of that category. 

I won't bother to give you a blow by blow description of the story, that's easily found elsewhere. I will tell you I was more than thoroughly entertained and, since it was a 48 hour rental via my VOD system, I took the opportunity to watch it three times because it was just that good! The film is endearing, funny and the performances are stellar, especially the youngsters. Huttlestone is already on his way as a multi-talent, but Nell Williams was a new revelation for me and she shines here. 

If for no other reason, you need to see this film for the incredibly brilliant work of Jonathan Rhys Meyers as Joe Strummer. He is simply mesmerizing and delivers a musical performance equal to that of any contemporary or historical rock star. (As a veteran of 7 Stones and 14 WHO concerts, I feel justified in that statement.) Derrick Borte managed to assemble a superb group of musicians to portray the rest of the band and the results are magical. 

London Town is a special film, with something for everyone to love. programme.title: Paul Newman: Błękitne oczy Hollywood
programme.desc: Bożyszcze światowego kina, Paul Newman, zasłynął licznymi kreacjami aktorskimi. Przeszedł do historii jako Butch Cassidy, nieugięty Luke, Rocky Graziano i Hud Bannon. Twórcy filmu przestawiają bogate dossier artysty, i to nie tylko aktorskie, ale też reżyserskie i producenckie. Poza tym opowiadają o życiu prywatnym Newmana. Pokazują go jako ojca, obywatela oraz pasjonata motoryzacji.

programme.title: Swing Vote
Najważniejszy głos
Swing Vote
programme.desc:
Swing Vote: Directed by Joshua Michael Stern. With Kevin Costner, Madeline Carroll, Paula Patton, Kelsey Grammer. In a remarkable turn-of-events, the result of the presidential election comes down to one man's vote." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1027862/","name":"Swing Vote","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwMTQyNzkwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTgyMzE3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a remarkable turn-of-events, the result of the presidential election comes down to one man's vote.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1027862/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MLDinTN"},"dateCreated":"2009-08-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"entertaining although not plausible","reviewBody":"Kevin Costner was actually in another decent movie. His last movie I saw, Mr. Brooks, was pretty good also. I would call this movie a political satire, that tries to be a little funny at times. However, the idea that one guy determines the presidential election is absurd, but if you can get past that, then the plot is OK. It was funny how the movie had the political parties doing adds for things they oppose. Example, the democrats supporting pro life because Bud says he's pro life.

The plot is struggling, every day man, Bud Johnson, just got laid off. He has a very smart daughter and she cares about the presidential election. Bud promises to vote since Molly thinks it's important. But, when he doesn't show, Molly votes in his place but the power goes out and the vote didn't count. The election comes down to New Mexico and for some reason, not told in the movie, Bud's vote will decide the electoral votes. I mean, how could the votes be even for each side and even if they were very close, how many months would it take for all the recounts that would take place. But any way, it's up to Bud, whom doesn't care about politics. He becomes an instant celebrity and is courted by both candidates. By the end of the film, Bud grows an appreciation for the political scene and realizes that it is important to care about social issues.

FINAL VERDICT: Funnier than I thought and provides a message. Plus, the movie doesn't try to say that one party is better than the other.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18365,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-08-01","keywords":"awakened by one's daughter,father daughter relationship,presidential candidate,election returns,election coverage","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Swing Vote","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2363687193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEwMDM1OTc1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA0MDczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEwMDM1OTc1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA0MDczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Swing Vote Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000126/","name":"Kevin Costner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1745736/","name":"Paula Patton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001288/","name":"Kelsey Grammer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0827750/","name":"Joshua Michael Stern"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023815/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0237137/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0725034/","name":"Jason Richman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0827750/","name":"Joshua Michael Stern"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1250389/","name":"David Giammarco"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Exorcist: The Beginning: Directed by Renny Harlin. With Stellan Skarsgård, Izabella Scorupco, James D'Arcy, Remy Sweeney. Years before Father Lankester Merrin helped save Regan MacNeil's soul, he first encounters the demon Pazuzu in East Africa. This is the tale of Father Merrin's initial battle with Pazuzu and the rediscovery of his faith." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0204313/","name":"Exorcist: The Beginning","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI0NzY1MzQ0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTM1MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Years before Father Lankester Merrin helped save Regan MacNeil's soul, he first encounters the demon Pazuzu in East Africa. This is the tale of Father Merrin's initial battle with Pazuzu and the rediscovery of his faith.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0204313/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"orven84"},"dateCreated":"2006-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Beginning over Dominion? Definitely","reviewBody":"First, let me say that I didn't know Dominion existed until I discovered it going through the program guide. I started watching and man was I confused! I though that there was ANOTHER prequel that I didn't know about, until I continued to watch. Dominion seemed to me like a movie made out of pieces of film on the floor of the editing room. Clara Bellar's acting was awful in my opinion. I was completely distracted by her performance as well as several others.

While not a true horror movie, I really enjoyed The Beginning. I've watched it many times and found it very suspenseful. It kept my attention. I enjoyed the actors and the story. I've watched it over ten times and the scenes where Father M had to choose those to die? Chilling. Who wouldn't lose faith? The boy being torn apart? There were some good scenes.

Peace","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36272,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-02-09","keywords":"lucifer morningstar character,supernatural horror,psychotronic film,cgi animal in live action title,movie flop","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Exorcist: The Beginning","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3262429721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNmNTMyZGMtNGI1My00OWRjLWE1ZGEtNDU5YmE1ZGFkYjBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNmNTMyZGMtNGI1My00OWRjLWE1ZGEtNDU5YmE1ZGFkYjBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001745/","name":"Stellan Skarsgård"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001713/","name":"Izabella Scorupco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0195439/","name":"James D'Arcy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001317/","name":"Renny Harlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067503/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0527643/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0087861/","name":"William Peter Blatty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936537/","name":"William Wisher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139627/","name":"Caleb Carr"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jabberwock
Jabberwock - Przebudzenie bestii
Jabberwock
programme.desc:
Jabberwock: Directed by Steven R. Monroe. With Tahmoh Penikett, Kacey Clarke, Raffaello Degruttola, Michael Worth. A brave knight returns to his homeland to find a powerful dragon terrorizing his village. After many unsuccessful attempts to defeat the monster, he makes a sword which has magical powers that should do the trick." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1734203/","name":"Jabberwock","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1Mzk4NTk3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDE5MTAyNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A brave knight returns to his homeland to find a powerful dragon terrorizing his village. After many unsuccessful attempts to defeat the monster, he makes a sword which has magical powers that should do the trick.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1734203/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BornKnight"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stay away from the Jabberwock","reviewBody":"This movie is one of the many produced by the SyFy Channel: in general they are regular to bad (mostly) productions, in all senses, and Jabberwock is not an exception.

The movie is about two travelers, in the Medieval Age (aparently in our world, since they mention the Romans), and who traveling by the mountains, find a lake with some egg like stones - that are in fact eggs of Jabberwock.

One of the eggs hatch, in a rainstorm (in this area there wasn't rain for decades), and a dragon like creature, the Jabberwock, emerges, killing one of the travelers and starts pursuing the other, who ends up in a village, where we meet the other protagonists.

The rest of the story is the hunt to kill this creature, among other small clichés hooks of tragedy, heroism and romance.

The movie has nice scenarios, but the general acting in the movie is terrible, with no exception. The Jabberwock itself is made with CG, and is relatively acceptable.

The action and fighting parts of the movie are the worst: the camera shifts from views from the men branding swords, and the CG monster, like bad movies of the 60-70's, among many other incongruence in story and actions that occurs.

By the way, "Jabberwocky" is a poem from Lewis Caroll, that appears in the sequences of the book Alice in Wonderland - and many things are related to it in the film) - I don't know and don't want to know why they done this (in general all writers from Scy-Fy Channel are the worst writers that I've seen).

The sound effects and background music you don't even realize if they were good or not, since they are generic, and in a absolute background in the movie.

At the end, this is a very bad choice of movie, even to watch if there's nothing interesting in the TV: I had the displeasure of watching it in 720p. 

I'd advise to stay away from the Jabberwock - my score: 2,0 / 10,0.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":660,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2011-09-10","keywords":"sword and sorcery,monster","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Curse of the Dragon","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4222331673","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTczZTkxMjctMTBlYi00YjZlLWJhOGItNjEyYTYxYmE2Y2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTczZTkxMjctMTBlYi00YjZlLWJhOGItNjEyYTYxYmE2Y2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Curse of the Dragon"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0671886/","name":"Tahmoh Penikett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0056041/","name":"Kacey Clarke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0214860/","name":"Raffaello Degruttola"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003458/","name":"Steven R. After many unsuccessful attempts to defeat the monster, he makes a sword which has magical powers that should do the trick." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1734203/","name":"Jabberwock","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1Mzk4NTk3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDE5MTAyNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A brave knight returns to his homeland to find a powerful dragon terrorizing his village. After many unsuccessful attempts to defeat the monster, he makes a sword which has magical powers that should do the trick.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1734203/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"BornKnight","dateCreated":"2012-03-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stay away from the Jabberwock","reviewBody":"This movie is one of the many produced by the SyFy Channel: in general they are regular to bad (mostly) productions, in all senses, and Jabberwock is not an exception.

The movie is about two travelers, in the Medieval Age (aparently in our world, since they mention the Romans), and who traveling by the mountains, find a lake with some egg like stones - that are in fact eggs of Jabberwock.

One of the eggs hatch, in a rainstorm (in this area there wasn't rain for decades), and a dragon like creature, the Jabberwock, emerges, killing one of the travelers and starts pursuing the other, who ends up in a village, where we meet the other protagonists.

The rest of the story is the hunt to kill this creature, among other small clichés hooks of tragedy, heroism and romance.

The movie has nice scenarios, but the general acting in the movie is terrible, with no exception. The Jabberwock itself is made with CG, and is relatively acceptable.

The action and fighting parts of the movie are the worst: the camera shifts from views from the men branding swords, and the CG monster, like bad movies of the 60-70's, among many other incongruence in story and actions that occurs.

By the way, "Jabberwocky" is a poem from Lewis Caroll, that appears in the sequences of the book Alice in Wonderland - and many things are related to it in the film) - I don't know and don't want to know why they done this (in general all writers from Scy-Fy Channel are the worst writers that I've seen).

The sound effects and background music you don't even realize if they were good or not, since they are generic, and in a absolute background in the movie.

At the end, this is a very bad choice of movie, even to watch if there's nothing interesting in the TV: I had the displeasure of watching it in 720p. 

I'd advise to stay away from the Jabberwock - my score: 2,0 / 10,0.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":660,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2011-09-10","keywords":"sword and sorcery,monster","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Curse of the Dragon","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4222331673","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTczZTkxMjctMTBlYi00YjZlLWJhOGItNjEyYTYxYmE2Y2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTczZTkxMjctMTBlYi00YjZlLWJhOGItNjEyYTYxYmE2Y2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Curse of the Dragon","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0671886/","name":"Tahmoh Penikett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0056041/","name":"Kacey Clarke","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0214860/","name":"Raffaello Degruttola"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003458/","name":"Steven R. programme.title: Another Country
Inny kraj
Another Country
programme.desc: Another Country: Directed by Marek Kanievska. With Rupert Everett, Colin Firth, Michael Jenn, Robert Addie. Based on the life of the young Guy Burgess, who would become better known as one of the Cambridge Spies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0086904/","name":"Another Country","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWExYjc2ZmYtOGE3OS00ZDA2LThmMDktODdhZGJlNDc4YmUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTMzOTU3NzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on the life of the young Guy Burgess, who would become better known as one of the Cambridge Spies.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0086904/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dawh1"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Burgess & Communism","reviewBody":"Guy Burgess became a communist, spied for the Soviet Union, and lived there for the rest of his life after he was found out. Why? Because, as far as we can tell from this movie, he was a homosexual, and British law was extremely harsh toward male homosexuals. That makes no sense at all. Soviet law was also extremely repressive against homosexuals in those days. No one would have chosen the Soviet Union because they thought it was more hospitable for gays. Since Guy Burgess was a real person and this film is based on his life, he must have had some other reason for becoming a communist (he wasn't one in his school days) that has nothing to do with his sexual orientation. What was it? The movie doesn't tell us."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5953,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"keywords":"homosexuality,boys' school,based on play,guy burgess character,morality","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000391/","name":"Rupert Everett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000147/","name":"Colin Firth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0421044/","name":"Michael Jenn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0437709/","name":"Marek Kanievska"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0045569/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147879/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593483/","name":"Julian Mitchell"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

What no one could have imagined is that, years before, Taylor had encountered this same terrifying creature. The film turns into a picture of hidden desires, romantic dreams and dangerous obsessions." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105085/","name":"The Paint Job","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOThjYWIxYmQtYTVhMC00MjZhLWIzMjctMDk2Yjc1ZTYyM2E2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTI1NTE2NjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"About a love triangle, involving house painter, his boss and the boss sensitive, vulnerable wife. The film turns into a picture of hidden desires, romantic dreams and dangerous obsessions.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105085/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"andreyev66"},"dateCreated":"2000-04-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A peculiar hybrid","reviewBody":"The Paint Job is a peculiar hybrid; it could be characterized as a thriller, a rather odd romantic comedy, and as a romantic satire. programme.title: Zombieland
Zombieland
programme.desc: Zombieland: Directed by Ruben Fleischer. With Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson, Emma Stone, Abigail Breslin. A shy student trying to reach his family in Ohio, a gun-toting bruiser in search of the last Twinkie and a pair of sisters striving to get to an amusement park join forces in a trek across a zombie-filled America." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1156398/","name":"Zombieland","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5MDg0NTQ1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjA4Mjg3Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A shy student trying to reach his family in Ohio, a gun-toting bruiser in search of the last Twinkie and a pair of sisters striving to get to an amusement park join forces in a trek across a zombie-filled America.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1156398/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"KillerK1991"},"dateCreated":"2009-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"America's answer to Shaun of the Dead.","reviewBody":"This film was a fun ride all the way through. It's lack of scariness(non existent) and *GASP!* gore is more than made up for with the constant flow of hilarity and likable characters. This is by far the optimist's zombie film, as the way things play out are definitely different than any one thats come before it(definitely not a Romero flick, though I think his Land of the Dead actually is second place in this regard). It has a sleek, very modern sense of style-just watch for how each rule makes it's appearance/reappearance and a good message on the importance of others in the worst of times. A shy student trying to reach his family in Ohio, a gun-toting bruiser in search of the last Twinkie and a pair of sisters striving to get to an amusement park join forces in a trek across a zombie-filled America." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1156398/","name":"Zombieland","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5MDg0NTQ1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjA4Mjg3Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A shy student trying to reach his family in Ohio, a gun-toting bruiser in search of the last Twinkie and a pair of sisters striving to get to an amusement park join forces in a trek across a zombie-filled America.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1156398/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"KillerK1991","dateCreated":"2009-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"America's answer to Shaun of the Dead.","reviewBody":"This film was a fun ride all the way through. It's lack of scariness(non existent) and *GASP!* gore is more than made up for with the constant flow of hilarity and likable characters. Three years after he last terrorized his sister, Michael Myers confronts her again, before traveling to Haddonfield to deal with the cast and crew of a reality show which is being broadcast from his old home." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0220506/","name":"Halloween: Resurrection","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODczZDMxNTMtZDIxOC00YWEzLWJkMmEtZjczNGUwZDA2NTNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three years after he last terrorized his sister, Michael Myers confronts her again, before traveling to Haddonfield to deal with the cast and crew of a reality show which is being broadcast from his old home.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0220506/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"StreepFan126"},"dateCreated":"2002-07-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why did they have to ruin it?","reviewBody":"Okay, it was not that bad of a movie. But why did they have to make it? Halloween H20 had ended just perfectly. Laurie Strode had finally conquered her fears, and had put an end to that monstor. programme.title: The Eye
Oko
The Eye
programme.desc:
The Eye: Directed by David Moreau, Xavier Palud. With Jessica Alba, Alessandro Nivola, Parker Posey, Rade Serbedzija. Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0406759/","name":"The Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjczYmJhNjUtOTdmYi00MzZlLWEzOWYtNzA1ZGZjMjkwY2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406759/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"grangers-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-03-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Alba reminds us that you may want to check where that donated organ came from.","reviewBody":"Jessica Alba plays a woman who undergoes cornea transplants in a remake of a Chinese film of the same name.

The moment she opens her eyes she starts to see things that aren't there. These include (a) a number of grim reapers, (b) recently dead people, (c) vivid images of someone else's past premonitions, and (d) a director and editor who aren't sure whether their making a horror film, thriller or a 'who dunnit?'.

There is a faint oriental air to the film with does add a bit of mystery. This is essentially a relatively cheaply made Alba-vehicle. There is no-one else in it other than a periodically appearing sister and a doctor who you never quite get interested in as he has nothing of worth to say.

You do jump from minor shock every now and then (but then an unexpected rapid orchestral crescendo does that to most people).

The film is similar in feel to Sarah Michelle-Gellar's The Grudge. You are left with a similar feeling when you leave the cinema; a resigned "it was okay".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52917,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-10-29","keywords":"corneal transplant,eye,violinist,eye transplant,seeing dead people","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi263323929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Eye Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004695/","name":"Jessica Alba"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219963/","name":"David Moreau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0658837/","name":"Xavier Palud"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179341/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0349406/","name":"Sebastian Gutierrez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1040327/","name":"Yuet-Jan Hui"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers
Halloween 6: Przekleństwo Michaela Myersa
Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers
programme.desc:
Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers: Directed by Joe Chappelle. With Donald Pleasence, Paul Rudd, Marianne Hagan, Mitchell Ryan. Six years after Michael Myers last terrorized Haddonfield, he returns there in pursuit of his niece, Jamie Lloyd, who has escaped with her newborn child, for which Michael and a mysterious cult have sinister plans." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113253/","name":"Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ3MjgzMWMtMjJhMy00MmVjLTllMzMtMWVjMmMxNTIzNWQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Six years after Michael Myers last terrorized Haddonfield, he returns there in pursuit of his niece, Jamie Lloyd, who has escaped with her newborn child, for which Michael and a mysterious cult have sinister plans.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113253/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sleepin_Dragon"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as bad as people make out.","reviewBody":"By this stage the franchise had really gotten tired, the previous few had been very poor, almost an insult to the fabulous original.

Of the first six films I would place this third overall, after one and two. It doesn't deserve its reputation as a bad film, because it isn't bad, nor is it great.

On the plus side, it has some scary moments, Michael's character is well used. The acting in general is rather good, it's quite slick, in a nineties way. On the debit side, the story is a little far fetched, and I didn't particularly like the cult element, it's like they tried to rewrite the show's past. It's a bit silly I guess, but....

At least it has Paul Rudd and the wonderful Donald Pleasance.

IMDb data; ttnr: 0113253, Title: Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers, --- Description: Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers: Directed by Joe Chappelle. With Donald Pleasence, Paul Rudd, Marianne Hagan, Mitchell Ryan. Six years after Michael Myers last terrorized Haddonfield, he returns there in pursuit of his niece, Jamie Lloyd, who has escaped with her newborn child, for which Michael and a mysterious cult have sinister plans." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113253/","name":"Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ3MjgzMWMtMjJhMy00MmVjLTllMzMtMWVjMmMxNTIzNWQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Six years after Michael Myers last terrorized Haddonfield, he returns there in pursuit of his niece, Jamie Lloyd, who has escaped with her newborn child, for which Michael and a mysterious cult have sinister plans.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113253/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Sleepin_Dragon","dateCreated":"2018-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as bad as people make out.","reviewBody":"By this stage the franchise had really gotten tired, the previous few had been very poor, almost an insult to the fabulous original.

Of the first six films I would place this third overall, after one and two. It doesn't deserve its reputation as a bad film, because it isn't bad, nor is it great.

On the plus side, it has some scary moments, Michael's character is well used. The acting in general is rather good, it's quite slick, in a nineties way. On the debit side, the story is a little far fetched, and I didn't particularly like the cult element, it's like they tried to rewrite the show's past. It's a bit silly I guess, but....

At least it has Paul Rudd and the wonderful Donald Pleasance.

programme.title: Il pentito
Skrucha
Il pentito
programme.desc:
Il pentito: Directed by Pasquale Squitieri. With Franco Nero, Tony Musante, Erik Estrada, Max von Sydow. A judge (based on real life judge Giovanni Falcone) on crusade to take down the Italian Mafia uses a gangster turned state's witness (a so-called "repenter") and a New York banker to do it. But things aren't quite what they seem." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0091744/","name":"Il pentito","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTMyZmYyMzgtODA4Zi00YTlhLWI3YjktYTUwOWZkYWY1MDllL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQ3Njg3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A judge (based on real life judge Giovanni Falcone) on crusade to take down the Italian Mafia uses a gangster turned state's witness (a so-called "repenter") and a New York banker to do it. But things aren't quite what they seem.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0091744/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Bunuel1976"},"dateCreated":"2008-12-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"THE REPENTER (Pasquale Squitieri, 1985) **1/2","reviewBody":"Serious-minded (i.e. not low-brow) yet obscure Mafia movie inspired by real events; I happened upon its Italian DVD at one of my local rental outlets. As expected, it's highlighted by extensive (and reasonably well-staged) shoot-outs 'interrupted' by (not exactly gripping) police detection and (all-too-familiar) domestic scenes.

The film does have has the benefit of a good cast  led by Franco Nero as the Magistrate standing in for the real-life Giovanni Falcone (he had tackled a similar role in Damiano Damiani's CONFESSIONS OF A POLICE CAPTAIN [1971]: here he's generally restrained apart from a dream sequence in which he's ambushed by gangsters) and Tony Musante as "Il Pentito" of the original title (an option suggested to him by Nero in order to put a stop to the ongoing gang war between two gangland factions: old-style/honorable and new/vicious).

The latter are typified by Erik Estrada who, at one point, is even sprung from jail but, at the end, is allowed to go free. Max von Sydow is both miscast and underused as the New York-based banker whose financial debacle blows the cover on the whole underworld operation, while the sensual Rita Rusic, future wife of tycoon Vittorio Cecchi Gori, plays his and Musante's contemporaneous lover. Ex-Bond Girl Claudine Auger is also briefly on hand as Musante's Sicilian wife, Marino Mase' appears as Nero's carabiniere sidekick, whereas Venantino Venantini turns up as one of the Mafia family heads.

The concluding moments are fairly interesting: Nero realizes that Musante had merely used him to get lawful revenge on his opponents  with a nice final shot which has a series of doors closing in front of our hero, symbolically depicting him shut inside a prison of his own making!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":109,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Crime","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"1985-11-15","keywords":"giovanni falcone,based on real person,based on real events,italian mafia,cosa nostra","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0626259/","name":"Franco Nero"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615540/","name":"Tony Musante"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261805/","name":"Erik Estrada"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0820155/","name":"Pasquale Squitieri"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064304/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0147601/","name":"Mario Cecchi Gori"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0820155/","name":"Pasquale Squitieri"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0056935/","name":"Orazio Barrese"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Brotherhood III: Young Demons
Przymierze III: Demony
The Brotherhood III: Young Demons
programme.desc: The Brotherhood III: Young Demons: Directed by David DeCoteau. With Kristopher Turner, Paul Andrich, Ellen Wieser, Julie Pedersen. A group of devil-may-care teenagers discover they've mistakenly called upon the Prince of Darkness in this flashy horror story. A handful of high school students have been entertaining themselves on weekends by playing an elaborate role-playing game in which they impersonate witches, warlocks, and other magical beings. One weekend, they decide to up the ante by breaking into the school and using the building's nooks and crannies to make the competition more challenging. One of the teens has brought along a book of magic spells, and they decide to throw some incantations into the games to make things more interesting. What the kids didn't count on is that the spells actually work, and soon the role-players have unleashed an unspeakable and dangerous force." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0310805/","name":"The Brotherhood III: Young Demons","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1NDQ4NzMyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTgyMzkxMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of devil-may-care teenagers discover they've mistakenly called upon the Prince of Darkness in this flashy horror story. programme.title: To the Ends of Time
Po wieczne czasy
To the Ends of Time
programme.desc: To the Ends of Time: Directed by Markus Rothkranz. With Joss Ackland, Christine Taylor, Tom Schultz, Sarah Douglas. In a mythical kingdom, a young boy must fight time for the love of his princess and the future of his land." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117929/","name":"To the Ends of Time","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc3YjViYWUtMThhZS00NGNiLTliYjEtMTA2MDIxYTBhMjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzMzMjU5NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a mythical kingdom, a young boy must fight time for the love of his princess and the future of his land.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117929/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"my_little_angel_Michael"},"dateCreated":"2008-01-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Must have","reviewBody":"This is a great movie, a must own. I really liked every aspect of it, from the sword fighting, the romance, the costumes were really well done and put together. The scenery is absolutely beautiful. I also loved the mystery and magic. Also the message of the power of love, that love is the greatest power there is. I really like the heart of the king in the sense that he desires peace instead of the bloodshed and hate. I wish that I could live in a world like that with flying ships, to castles in the sky. I also think that it was really nice how they brought the animals into the movie. I also thought that the cook was really funny. I have watched it many times in one day and still never tire of it. Just wish they would bring it onto a DVD.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":199,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1996-11-30","keywords":"sword and sorcery","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000722/","name":"Joss Ackland"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852132/","name":"Christine Taylor"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0776365/","name":"Tom Schultz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0745209/","name":"Markus Rothkranz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013199/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0072913/","name":"Daniel Benton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0745209/","name":"Markus Rothkranz"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

Inny kraj
Another Country
programme.desc: Another Country: Directed by Marek Kanievska. With Rupert Everett, Colin Firth, Michael Jenn, Robert Addie. Based on the life of the young Guy Burgess, who would become better known as one of the Cambridge Spies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0086904/","name":"Another Country","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWExYjc2ZmYtOGE3OS00ZDA2LThmMDktODdhZGJlNDc4YmUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTMzOTU3NzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on the life of the young Guy Burgess, who would become better known as one of the Cambridge Spies.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0086904/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dawh1"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Burgess & Communism","reviewBody":"Guy Burgess became a communist, spied for the Soviet Union, and lived there for the rest of his life after he was found out. Why? Because, as far as we can tell from this movie, he was a homosexual, and British law was extremely harsh toward male homosexuals. That makes no sense at all. Soviet law was also extremely repressive against homosexuals in those days. No one would have chosen the Soviet Union because they thought it was more hospitable for gays. Since Guy Burgess was a real person and this film is based on his life, he must have had some other reason for becoming a communist (he wasn't one in his school days) that has nothing to do with his sexual orientation. What was it? The movie doesn't tell us."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5953,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"keywords":"homosexuality,boys' school,based on play,guy burgess character,morality","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000391/","name":"Rupert Everett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000147/","name":"Colin Firth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0421044/","name":"Michael Jenn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0437709/","name":"Marek Kanievska"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0045569/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147879/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593483/","name":"Julian Mitchell"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Force 10 from Navarone
Komandosi z Navarony
Force 10 from Navarone
programme.desc:
Force 10 from Navarone: Directed by Guy Hamilton. With Robert Shaw, Harrison Ford, Barbara Bach, Edward Fox. During World War II, several oddly assorted military experts are teamed in a mission to raid and destroy a bridge vital to enemy strategy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0077572/","name":"Force 10 from Navarone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTNjZGYyYzktMDYyOC00NDMwLTg3MGItNjU2MGQwN2I5MjlhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwNzk3NDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"During World War II, several oddly assorted military experts are teamed in a mission to raid and destroy a bridge vital to enemy strategy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0077572/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vip_ebriega"},"dateCreated":"2007-02-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"FORCE 10 FROM NAVARONE is a great yarn.","reviewBody":"My Take: Often lambasted, but fast-paced and highly entertaining sequel to the classic adventure film. 

Honestly, I think "Force 10 from Navarone" was more fast-paced, action-packed and hilarious as it's predecessor, "The Guns of Navarone", but then, it also lacks the stronger elements that made its predecessor better. But it seems unfair to compare a sequel to its predecessor when the film is a sequel in name only. Other than the opening which re-tracks the memorable final scenes from the original, FORCE 10 FROM NAVARONE mostly flies solo. 

The cast was excellent. Robert Shaw and Edward Fox are good replacements to Gregory Peck and David Niven in the roles of Keith Mallory and Major Miller. Harrison Ford absolutely amazing as Lt. Col. Barnsby. Carl Weathers is usually out of place, but he's fine enough. While Barbara Bach and Richard Kiel offer fine performances after their roles in "The Spy Who Loved Me".

There will be a few hate remarks from fans of the original, but seeing it as not a sequel to the classic film and more of a film that uses 'Guns' as its inspiration, this "sequel" is fun, exciting and occasionally excellent. 

Rating: **** out of 5.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17665,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1978-12-07","keywords":"partisan,german army,collapsing bridge,booby trap,prison guard","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2111225881","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI4NmFlYzQtM2I1YS00ZjQ5LWEyNjctMGVhOTVhZmZlOTEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzI4NmFlYzQtM2I1YS00ZjQ5LWEyNjctMGVhOTVhZmZlOTEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000148/","name":"Harrison Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001727/","name":"Robert Shaw"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002081/","name":"Edward Fox"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0357891/","name":"Guy Hamilton"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079398/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022781/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0533745/","name":"Alistair MacLean"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0152509/","name":"Robin Chapman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0286025/","name":"Carl Foreman"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Polar Opposites
Bieguny śmierci
Polar Opposites
programme.desc:
Polar Opposites: Directed by Fred Olen Ray. With Charles Shaughnessy, Tracy Nelson, Ken Barnett, Beth Grant. David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1172069/","name":"Polar Opposites","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMDg0MTQwNjReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDkyNTI2ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1172069/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SciVortex"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Science-Fact Rocks the World","reviewBody":"If you're expecting a splashy, big-budget Hollywood disaster flick, you should stick to "The Day After Tomorrow" or "Deep Impact." "Polar Opposites" strength does NOT come from million dollar fx, or performances by academy-award-winning actors. The thing that makes this low-budget independent film so engaging is the story and the relationships that develop while the story world unravels on screen.

At its simplest, "Polar Opposites" spins a tale about a possible global disaster set in motion by a nuclear blast, and how a scientist is called upon to save the day. The scientific theories proposed by the story are chillingly accurate, and they are what hooked me initially. It's refreshing to see science-fact made understandable and yes, entertaining (the tangerine/battery visual was funny). But the film goes beyond simply laying out facts and ideas to tell the story. It puts together a group of characters that have real issues in dealing with the problem, and with each other. There is a father/son relationship (Charles Shaunessy and Clive Revill) that is touching and real, funny and even corny at times. Tracey Nelson and Kieren Hutchinson play doctors coping with the crisis, but they still have a playful side to their relationship. And the actor playing their patient, Al (Ismael Carlo), is both unsettling and tender.

In the end, the disaster unfolds like it might in any other disaster flick (although, as I mentioned, without the huge big budget fx). IMDb data; ttnr: 1172069, Title: Polar Opposites, --- Description: Polar Opposites: Directed by Fred Olen Ray. With Charles Shaughnessy, Tracy Nelson, Ken Barnett, Beth Grant. David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1172069/","name":"Polar Opposites","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMDg0MTQwNjReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDkyNTI2ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1172069/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"SciVortex","dateCreated":"2008-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Science-Fact Rocks the World","reviewBody":"If you're expecting a splashy, big-budget Hollywood disaster flick, you should stick to "The Day After Tomorrow" or "Deep Impact." "Polar Opposites" strength does NOT come from million dollar fx, or performances by academy-award-winning actors. The thing that makes this low-budget independent film so engaging is the story and the relationships that develop while the story world unravels on screen.

At its simplest, "Polar Opposites" spins a tale about a possible global disaster set in motion by a nuclear blast, and how a scientist is called upon to save the day. The scientific theories proposed by the story are chillingly accurate, and they are what hooked me initially. It's refreshing to see science-fact made understandable and yes, entertaining (the tangerine/battery visual was funny). But the film goes beyond simply laying out facts and ideas to tell the story. It puts together a group of characters that have real issues in dealing with the problem, and with each other. There is a father/son relationship (Charles Shaunessy and Clive Revill) that is touching and real, funny and even corny at times. Tracey Nelson and Kieren Hutchinson play doctors coping with the crisis, but they still have a playful side to their relationship. And the actor playing their patient, Al (Ismael Carlo), is both unsettling and tender.

In the end, the disaster unfolds like it might in any other disaster flick (although, as I mentioned, without the huge big budget fx). But the story and the characters were the ingredient that actually made the film quite enjoyable.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-06-06","keywords":"nuclear test,friendship,scientist,writer,earthquake","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Deadly Shift","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi887948825","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4NDlhODktN2NlMy00YTY3LWE3MjItY2ZmMjkyMWUyODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4NDlhODktN2NlMy00YTY3LWE3MjItY2ZmMjkyMWUyODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Ground Zero: The Deady Shift aka Polar Opposites","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0789478/","name":"Charles Shaughnessy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0625796/","name":"Tracy Nelson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1757373/","name":"Ken Barnett"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0676248/","name":"Fred Olen Ray"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0167713/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563701/","name":"Paolo Mazzucato"],"duration":"PT1H25M"</script><metacontent="
